title: How to Make Shot Glass Candles

steps.headline: Break up all your old, half burned candles into a measuring cup.
steps.description: You can use discolored wax if you are planning on adding some wax dye.

steps.headline: Place the measuring cup into a pan of boiling water until the wax melts.
Watch to see when the wax has almost completely melted.
steps.description: At this point, you will be able to add the wax dye (if your original wax is discolored).

steps.headline: Place the wicks inside the shot glasses.
steps.description: Make sure you only use glass shot glasses or any other thick glass. Put a small drop of glue on the tip, and press that into the bottom center of the glass to make sure the wick stays put.

steps.headline: When the wax has melted down, pour the wax into each shot glass.
steps.description: Be careful not to submerge the entire wick.

steps.headline: When the wax is almost completely set, move the wick into the center of the glass and then leave it to fully set.
steps.description: Wax contracts as it cools, so you may need to do pour more wax after the candle has set.

tyn: A shot glass or any thick glass
A small drop of fast-dry glue
text: Break up all your old, half burned candles into a measuring cup. You can use discolored wax if you are planning on adding some wax dye. Place the measuring cup into a pan of boiling water until the wax melts.  Watch to see when the wax has almost completely melted. At this point, you will be able to add the wax dye (if your original wax is discolored). Place the wicks inside the shot glasses. Make sure you only use glass shot glasses or any other thick glass. Put a small drop of glue on the tip, and press that into the bottom center of the glass to make sure the wick stays put. When the wax has melted down, pour the wax into each shot glass. Be careful not to submerge the entire wick. When the wax is almost completely set, move the wick into the center of the glass and then leave it to fully set. Wax contracts as it cools, so you may need to do pour more wax after the candle has set. Finished!
